summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, providing a heads-up about information learned from WilmerHale attorneys representing J.P. Morgan. The information indicates that Barclays bank is planning to issue a public statement the following day announcing that its former CEO, Jes Staley, is "under investigation," potentially in connection with the Epstein case.

events.description: Attorneys from WilmerHale representing J.P. Morgan in the Epstein case informed the prosecutor that Barclays was planning to make the aforementioned public statement.

keyFacts: Barclays bank was planning to issue a public statement on February 13, 2020, announcing that its former CEO, Jes Staley, was 'under investigation.'
The information about Barclays' planned statement came from WilmerHale attorneys representing J.P. Morgan in connection with the Epstein case and J.P. Morgan's own internal investigation.
It was unclear from the communication whether the planned statement would specify the investigating body (financial regulators vs. law enforcement) or explicitly reference the Epstein case.
The communication shows coordination and information sharing between the U.S. Attorney's Office and private counsel for a major financial institution (J.P. Morgan) involved in the Epstein case.
